author: kalgiz
body:
## PR Summary

Add | Out-String -Width 120 to tests with Format-Table command. The tests are not passing on vsts due a bug in Format-Table command (probably unspecified dimensions of the console).
The temporary solution for issue: #6748

- [x] [Make sure all `.h`, `.cpp`, `.cs`, `.ps1` and `.psm1` files have the correct copyright header](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [x] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` to the beginning of the title and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.
- **User-facing changes**

    - [ ] User-facing [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
        - [ ] Issue filed - Issue link:
- **Testing - New and feature**

    - **OR**
    - [ ] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)
        - [ ] [Add `[feature]` if the change is significant or affects feature tests](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/testing-guidelines.md#requesting-additional-tests-for-a-pr)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I don't like the temporary solution. If `Format-Table` has a bug we should fix it.

comments.author: kalgiz
comments.body: The solution is only temporary so that to not be blocked when migrating the builds on different service (currently the tests for Format-Table are failing on vsts). The issue with Format-Table would still remain open and would be fixed later.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: MSFT could skip this tests on VSTS but not on GitHub.

comments.author: kalgiz
comments.body: Do we want to just skip the tests for the environment where they are not working for now?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Can we root cause why it's failing in VSTS?  Perhaps in VSTS there is a console, but the width is zero?  @kalgiz can you just run `pwsh -c [console]::WindowWidth` in VSTS and see what it returns?

comments.author: kalgiz
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT I checked the console width in vsts and it is equal to 0. That is why the output from Format-Table is null.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
It is better fix this in code - there may be other similar environments.
I believe it is [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/System.Management.Automation/FormatAndOutput/common/BaseOutputtingCommand.cs#L777)

comments.author: kalgiz
comments.body: I prepared a PR #6883 to fix the issue, so I am closing this one.

title: Add | Out-String -Width 120 to tests with Format-Table command.
